org.mocksy.rules
Class Ruleset

java.lang.Object
  org.mocksy.rules.Ruleset

public class Ruleset
extends Object

Represents a group of Rules. The only reason that this is separated from the RulesetRule class is to be better suited for the top-level set of Rules. However, the separate also makes it a little easier to separate Rulesets physically, allowing the Rule that delegates to the Ruleset to be managed in one area, and the list of rules in another (see the documentation about XML configuration files). A Ruleset can be associated with a UpdateableRulesetFactory, which allows it to be easily updated during runtime, e.g. responding to updates in file-based configuration without need to recycling the server.

Author:
Saleem Shafi

public Ruleset()

Ruleset

public Ruleset(UpdateableRulesetFactory factory)
Creates a Ruleset with an associated UpdateableRulesetFactory, which will help to update the contents of the Ruleset, if needed.

Parameters:
config - the UpdateableRulesetFactory instance used to build this Ruleset
Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Clears the contents of this Ruleset in preparation for it to be re-populated either by the UpdateableRulesetFactory or programmatically for the first time.

addRule

public void addRule(Rule rule)
Adds a Rule to this Ruleset. Rules are processed in order and this method will add the given Rule to the end of the current list.

Parameters:
rule - the Rule to add to the end of this Ruleset

setDefaultRule

public void setDefaultRule(Rule defaultRule)
Sets the Rule object to return if none of the Rules are suitable for a given Request.

Parameters:
defaultRule - the default Rule for this ruleset

process

public Response process(Request request)
                 throws Exception
Processes the given Request by checking to see if any of the Rules can be used to generate a Response. If not, the default response is returned. Before processing the Request, if a UpdateableRulesetFactory was provided, we'll first check for updates to the configuration and update the contents of the Ruleset before continuing with the processing. Note: The logic that updates the Ruleset based on the UpdateableRulesetFactory is synchronized, so it should be thread-safe.

Parameters:
request - the Request to process
Returns:
the Response from the appropriate Rule in the Ruleset; or the default response if none of the Rules match
Throws:
Exception

getDefaultRule

public Rule getDefaultRule()
Returns the default Rule instance for this Ruleset.

Returns:
the default Rule

getRules

public List<Rule> getRules()
Returns the list of Rules comprising this Ruleset.

Returns:
list of Rules in the Ruleset
